name: Animal Kingdom Spot the Difference Picture Hunter Puzzle Games for Kids and Family- Search and find differences in each pic! Educational Edition
name_original: Animal Kingdom Spot the Difference Picture Hunter Puzzle Games for Kids and Family- Search and find differences in each pic! Educational Edition
description:
Are you ready to enter an adorable world of wide-eyed woodland creatures to solve some fun wildlife puzzles? With beautiful graphics from children’s book illustrator Debbie Palen, these 24 levels of cats, dogs, squirrels, owls, bees and butterflies will delight boys and girls as they find all the differences in this classic spot-the-differences puzzle game.

Your children will love these detailed and friendly illustrations of animals doing what they do best! Bats are hanging out, frogs are croaking, bears are hibernating, crows are having a picnic and even a pair of friendly dalmatians are howling along with a fire truck. Toddlers, preschoolers and kids alike will have hours of fun quizzing their memory while hunting through pictures of woodpeckers in a cafe, a bumblebee rock’n’roll band, a wintery flock of crows and a squirrel stealing a big bag of acorns. Puppies, mom and baby birds and owls all sleep in the moonlight, lizards and pigs sun themselves on the beach and kittens play with catnip- with so many fun images to try, kids will learn observation skills while enjoying these charming and hand-painted illustrations.

The game will give you hints where to look more carefully if you need help finding all the differences. Celebrate with fireworks when you find all of them in time!
This educational puzzle game is great for the whole family- all images are appropriate for all ages.

-This app includes 24 levels.
-No third party advertisements.
-Internet connection not required to play.
-Does not contain links to social networks.
-Does not use data collection tools.
-Contains links to developer's other apps and artist's online portfolio from the Credits page.

Art by Debbie Palen.
Reprinted from Ranger Rick magazine with the permission of the National Wildlife Federation.

Please see our privacy policy for more information.
